titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Program in Judaic Studies, Yale University, Records
Program in Judaic Studies, Yale University, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:38

did.unittitle: Program in Judaic Studies, Yale University, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of correspondence, subject files, and newsletters of the Program in Judaic Studies at Yale University. Topics include faculty, courses and seminars, lectures, search committees, and the Yale Judaica Series.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. Program in Judaic Studies

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 14-B (YRG 14-B), Records of academic departments and programs of the Yale Faculty of Arts and Sciences.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records were transferred from the Program in Judaic Studies, 2005.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Program in Judaic Studies, Yale University, Records (RU 978) Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Program in Judaic Studies (formerly the Judaic Studies Program at Yale) offers an interdisciplinary approach to undergraduate and graduate study of the religion, history, literature, languages, and material culture of the Jews from ancient to modern times.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of correspondence, subject files, and newsletters of the Program in Judaic Studies at Yale University. Topics include faculty, courses and seminars, lectures, search committees, and the Yale Judaica Series.
